de.hohenheim.view.mobile.animation

Class BusyWaitAnimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • de.hohenheim.view.mobile.animation.BusyWaitAnimator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Animator, java.lang.Runnable

    public class BusyWaitAnimator
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.lang.Runnable, Animator
    This class let the busy indicator of the fork truck start to blink. It also lets the fork truck wait till a State Object is unblocked. In this time the fork truck does nothing other then show a very small blinking rectangle.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Arthur Kaul, Besim Gashi, Mathias Zwiesele, Daniel Intili, Bernd Hofs‰ﬂ

    • Constructor Detail

      • BusyWaitAnimator

        public BusyWaitAnimator(NodeMap map,
                AnimationFigure figure,
                State state)
        Parameters:
        {@link - NodeMap} map - The RoomMap where the fork truck is located.
        {@link - AnimationFigure} figure - The animated figure itself.
        State - state - A State Object. Typically of a node or a mobile object or a path. This Object tells if the object is blocked or unblocked. E.g. a path can be blocked so that a mobile object can not walk along the path, till the path is unblocked.

    • Method Detail

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Indicates if the animation is finished.
        Specified by:
        isFinished in interface Animator
        Returns:
        boolean - true if the animation is finished.

      • run

        public void run()
        runs the animation and restarts itself as long as the animation is not finished. After it is finished the observer listening for the finished event is notified. Don't use this method to start the animation!
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the animation. Can also be used to restart the animation if it was stopped. To start(run) the animation only use this method!
        Specified by:
        start in interface Animator

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the animation. The animation can be restarted with @see start()
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Animator

        Returns true, if the animation is stopped.
